paras.para: So 10 years on I don't know modes.  So I'm a lifetime member of the SBL and I barely use it.  So I paid for 4 or so extra courses in SBL and haven't completed them.  So I paid for April course and have stopped it.  So I've a million bass books ðŸ“š and have only read a few and rarely start to finish.
So what's my problem? Procrastination? Lazy? Too busy with life balance work and kids? Rather play covers? A bit of everything?

I want to get better and I know that lies in putting in the work into theory. I usually get my practice time every other night and I do just like playing covers. I like trying to transcribe, trying to improvise over existing songs.  But I do want to write more of my own content but never seem to have enough time lately.

I find the SBL has lots of nattering and it puts me off as I just want to play not listen to wordy videos ðŸ¤«.  The April course I was finding too much for beginners and I didn't like the way it was directed to go watch someone else's covers on youtube, I gave that feedback when prompted too.
Maybe I need to catch myself on and do a Mel Robbins 5,4,3,2,1 and just get it done ðŸ˜‚. ðŸŽ“
